portfolio.title: Cybersecurity Enthusiast | Web Developer | Always learning, always breaking (then fixing)

about.name: About
about.intro: Hello! I’m Khanh Duy Nguyen Tu, a passionate Cybersecurity enthusiast and aspiring Pentester with a strong foundation in computer science, hands-on experience in binary security research, and a side gig as a freelance Web Developer. I enjoy building secure, user-focused web applications while deepening my skills in offensive security. My journey in tech is driven by curiosity, continuous learning, and a desire to contribute to systems that are both functional and secure. I thrive in collaborative, challenge-driven environments-whether it’s fuzzing binaries, exploring CTFs, or delivering fullstack solutions to clients.

task: Creation of UX/UI-optimized responsive interfaces for mobile and desktop devices
Backend development (RESTful API, Node.js, PHP) and WordPress integration
Optimization of loading times by up to 40% through integration of SEO and performance best practices (Lazy loading, minification, CDN)
Designed and implemented a custom binary sanitizer (C/C++) for ARM-Thumb binaries, improving detection of memory violations by 60–70%
Integrated AFL-Unicorn to optimize binary fuzzing pipeline
Fixed critical persistent bug in AFL-Unicorn allowing new exploitation method
Conducted research of state-of-the-art binary sanitizer
Writing technical documentation to reduce onboarding time for new developers

cyber: SOC : Wireshark, Snort, Yara, ELK, Splunk
Pentest : Metasploit, Nmap, Burp Suite, Bloodhound, AFL-Unicorn

list.name: Membership Inference Attack (MIA) Analysis

interests.name: Interests
interests.des: Alongside studies and works, I actively strengthen my skills through plateforms like Rootme, HackTheBox, TryHackMe, CryptoHack

list.thm: TryHackMe is an online cybersecurity training platform that offers hands-on labs and guided tutorials for learners of all levels. It covers a wide range of topics including penetration testing, SOC analyst, DevOps, and more. It's beginner-friendly, with interactive virtual machines, step-by-step tasks, and gamified learning paths.
list.rootme: Root-Me is a platform dedicated to cybersecurity challenges and CTF (Capture The Flag) exercises. It provides wide variety of challenges in fields like cryptography, steganography, web security, reverse engineering, and system exploitation.
list.htb: Hack The Box is a cybersecurity training platform designed for professionals and enthusiasts to practice hacking skills in realistic environments. It offers a wide range of vulnerable machines, labs, and scenarios ranging from beginner to expert levels.
list.cryptohack: CryptoHack is a educational platform focused exclusively on cryptography. It offers a collection of interactive, Python-based challenges that teach both the theory and practical application of modern cryptographic systems.
